capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just reading about Minerva McGonagall and it's clear that she's an adult. I mean, she's been teaching Transfiguration at Hogwarts for years, so you can definitely say she's a grown-up.

You know, I've always been fascinated by Professor McGonagall's character in the Harry Potter series. She's an amazing example of a strong and independent woman who isn't afraid to speak her mind. I mean, she's an adult, but she still has this youthful energy about her that's really inspiring. (CERTAINTY: 0.8) (POLARITY: POSITIVE) (SENTIMENT: ADMIRATION) (EMOTION: RESPECTFUL)

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I was just reading about Minerva McGonagall and it's clear that she's an adult. I mean, she's already established herself as a Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts, which is no easy feat for someone her age. She seems like a very confident person, and I can see why she'd be considered certain in her abilities.

I think Professor McGonagall is an amazing role model, I mean, she's been teaching at Hogwarts for decades and still manages to be so fierce and fair. She's definitely an adult in every sense of the word, you know?

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think Professor McGonagall is an amazing teacher and mentor. I mean, she's not only a skilled witch but also a talented Transfiguration professor at Hogwarts. Her no-nonsense attitude and high expectations always push me to be my best self.

I've always admired Professor McGonagall's strength and courage, especially as a trans woman in a world where she had to navigate both her magical abilities and her identity. I think it's really inspiring that she was able to be so confident and authentic, even when faced with challenges from those who didn't understand her.
